channel.title: Comments on: Blogging Tip – Removing Sensitive Information from Images
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Chuck Rummel
item.dc:creator: Chuck Rummel
item.description: I use screenpresso (perhaps @SQLBob showed it to me?) and it sounds similar to what jing does, not sure about the video part, maybe I'll have to try jing next.
item.content:encoded: I use screenpresso (perhaps @SQLBob showed it to me?) and it sounds similar to what jing does, not sure about the video part, maybe I’ll have to try jing next.

item.title: By: Eli Weinstock-Herman (tarwn)
item.dc:creator: Eli Weinstock-Herman (tarwn)
item.description: Windows 7 will also let you create a shortcut for the snipping tool. If you right click the icon in start menu and go to properties you can define a global keyboard shortcut. I use Ctrl+F12 consistently on my systems. It's not quite as fast as SnagIt or Jing to come up, but it's handier then going and finding it each time you need it.
item.content:encoded: Windows 7 will also let you create a shortcut for the snipping tool. If you right click the icon in start menu and go to properties you can define a global keyboard shortcut. I use Ctrl+F12 consistently on my systems. It’s not quite as fast as SnagIt or Jing to come up, but it’s handier then going and finding it each time you need it.

item.title: By: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.dc:creator: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.description: That looks pretty cool, Jonathan. Thanks! Downloading it now and will give it a go. Always loved snagit so bet it will be really good.
item.content:encoded: That looks pretty cool, Jonathan. Thanks! Downloading it now and will give it a go. Always loved snagit so bet it will be really good.

item.title: By: Fatherjack
item.dc:creator: Fatherjack
item.description: Great advice Ted. I have used Paint.Net for years too but something I got recently was Jing. Its from TechSmith - the people that sell SnagIt. Its like a trimmed down version that does screen grabs and allows you to edit/annotate them during the save process. You can also configure it to do short video captures of your desktop. I'd recommend giving it a try. http://www.techsmith.com/jing.html
item.content:encoded: Great advice Ted. I have used Paint.Net for years too but something I got recently was Jing. Its from TechSmith – the people that sell SnagIt. Its like a trimmed down version that does screen grabs and allows you to edit/annotate them during the save process. You can also configure it to do short video captures of your desktop. I’d recommend giving it a try. http://www.techsmith.com/jing.html
